encodeAttestation((address,(string,strin.details: Encodes an attestation into a bytes32 hash. The encoding includes all fields in the attestation structure, ensuring a unique hash representing the data.

returns._0: A bytes32 hash of the encoded attestation.

encodeRequest((string,string,string,stri.details: Encodes a network request into a bytes32 hash. The encoding includes the URL, headers, HTTP method, and body of the request.

returns._0: A bytes32 hash of the encoded network request.

encodeResponse((string,string,string)[]).details: Encodes a list of network response resolutions into a bytes32 hash. This iterates through the response array and encodes each field, creating a unique hash representing the full response data.

params.reponse: The array of response resolutions to encode.

returns._0: A bytes32 hash of the encoded response resolutions.

initialize(address).details: initialize function to set the owner of the contract. This function is called during the contract deployment.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeAttestor(address).details: Removes the attestor for a specific recipient. Requirements: - The caller must be the owner of the contract.          attestorAddr

params.attestorAddr: The address of the recipient whose attestor is to be removed.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setAttestor((address,string)).details: Allows the owner to set the attestor for a specific recipient. Requirements: - The caller must be the owner of the contract.

params.attestor: The attestor to associate with the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyAttestation((address,(string,strin.details: Verifies the validity of a given attestation. Requirements: - Attestation must contain valid signatures from attestors. - The data, request, and response must be consistent. - The attestation must not be expired based on its timestamp.

params.attestation: The attestation data to be verified.
